radirius.merc.graphics

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • radirius.merc.graphics.Texture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SubTexture

    public class Texture
extends Object
implements Resource
    An object version of a texture. This will store the width and height of the object.
    Author:
    wessles

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture

        public Texture(int textureid,
       int width,
       int height,
       BufferedImage bufimage,
       ByteBuffer buf)
        Make a texture of the textureid, with a width and height, based off of bufferedimage buf.
        Parameters:
        textureid - The id of the texture.
        width - The width of the texture.
        height - The height of the texture.
        bufimage - The source of the image, the bufferedimage.
        buf - The original buffer.

      • setExpandToPowerOfTwo

        public static void setExpandToPowerOfTwo(boolean expand2PoT)
        Sets whether or not all Textures will be expanded to the nearest power of two. Keep in mind before you change this: PoT Textures allow for great things like GL_REPEAT, and faster rendering time. Certain aspect of the library may break, should you choose to mess with this value. Seriously, you can use the non-PoT SubTextures in much the same for the most part. Mess with at your own risk.
